engine.input

Class Mouse

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.input.Mouse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Mouse
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    This singleton Mouse does not need to be constructed. The only available Mouse object can be accessed from MouseInputListener.instance. From this class you may access the Mouse's last position and check if any of the three standard buttons are pressed. Functions can be bound to each of the three standard buttons by adding an object that implements KeyFunction to the appropriate button. Only one KeyFunction can be added to each button.
    Author:
    Michael

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Mouse instance
      The MainWindow automatically accesses this to process mouse motion and mouse pressed events.

    • Field Detail

      • instance

        public static final Mouse instance
        The MainWindow automatically accesses this to process mouse motion and mouse pressed events. You should only have to access the static methods in this class.
